newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico bolsa lists 12 pension mutual funds.
newsitem.headline: Mexico bolsa lists 12 pension mutual funds.

text.p: Most of Mexico's newly privatized penion schemes, or Afores, now have a corresponding specialized mutual fund listed with the Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV), a BMV on-line statement said.

Since July 1, Mexican workers have been able to opt out of a state pension scheme and into one of 17 pension funds administrating funds called Afores. Each Afore must invest in a specialized mutual fund known as a Siefore.
As of Friday July 18, 12 of 17 Afores had listed a Siefore with the BMV.
By law Siefores may not invest in equities and have to channel at least 51 percent of their capital into instruments denominated in inflation-indexed investment units, or UDIs.
